question:
In context of the recently discovered circumbinary planet TOI 1338 b, consider the following statements:
  1. Circumbinary planets orbit around two stars.
  2. Circumbinary planets always occur in pairs.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: Circumbinary planets are those planets that orbit around two stars instead of the usual single star. They are found orbiting binary star systems. The planet usually has a stable orbit around one of the two stars. There are several confirmed circumbinary planets. Statement 2 is incorrect: The term circumbinary refers to the orbiting of the planet around 2 stars. The newly discovered exoplanet, TOI 1338 b is one such planet found in the TOI 1338 stellar system. It is 6.9 times larger than earth. It is the 13th of its kind.
